Module.ModuleTitle: An Interdisciplinary Approach to China: Health and Humanity

Faculty.FacultyName: Faculty of Social and Historical Sciences

ModuleInstance.ModuleInstanceDescription:
Compulsory module for students on the MA Chinese Health and Humanity degree programme. This module will be delivered by specialists in different fields critical to the interdisciplinary understanding of health in China. Students will be exposed to social sciences, anthropological and historical approaches to concepts of health and therapeutics in the classical world and their legacy. Topics may include narrative medicine, film and the medical humanities, food politics, medical law, health systems, and ageing. Some of the lectures will be delivered by China specialists; others, such as anthropologists, environmentalists and lawyers, will be leaders in their respective fields. Each two-hour session comprises a lecture and a seminar where students present readings in Chinese and English.

More information about History modules can be found on our website: http://www.ucl.ac.uk/history/current-students.
